text:
When running the testsuite several times the memory consumption of Slide grows
all the time. This might simply be due to garbage, but might also mean there is
a memory leak somewhere.
creator: ozeigermann@apache.org

text:
I've had a server up for several weeks (maybe even a month or two) under
constant usage with no problems. I'm using a MySQL store with no bindings. If
there's a problem, I'm not seeing it, so it may be with a store implementation
or perhaps bindings.

Also, this is 2.1b1.
creator: masonjm@apache.org

text:
I did more checks and could not find any indication there is a memory leak.
Still, quite some garbage is produced. If I have some time I will try and see if
there are hot spots for new objects and see if there is anything we can do. If
not, this would not be bad either...

Reducing severity to minor for.
creator: ozeigermann@apache.org

text:
I have seen a memory leak in Slide 2.1 when running in the cluster cache 
configuration with notifications enabled. It seems to be related to the 
notification mechanism specifically as disabling the cluster cache (but not the 
subscriptions) did not halt the leak. Only when I disabled the subscriptions
as well as disabling the cluster cache did the leak stop. The leak was in the 
master Slide server sending the notifications rather than the slave.
creator: wburrows@e2open.com

This is probably obsolete? org.apache.slide.common.Namespace revision 231018 or
higher no longer uses URI cache - see bug #34282.
